summary: Plugin for C/C++/ObjC/ObjC++ include directive completion.
name: inccomplete
description:
This is a completion plugin for C/C++/ObjC/ObjC++ preprocessors include directive.

It can complete both \"\" and <> forms of #include.
For \"\" it gets all header files in the current directory (so it&#039s assumed that you have something similar to \"autocmd BufEnter,BufWinEnter * lcd %:p:h\" in your .vimrc).
And for <> it gets all files that have hpp or h extensions or don&#039t have any.

It uses GNU find utility to find header files.

You could always find the latest version on github: http://github.com/xaizek/vim-inccomplete 
Feel free to contact me if you have any question or suggestions.
install_details:
Just extract vim-inccomplete.zip into your ~/.vim/ or ~/vimfiles/ (~/.vim/bundle/ or ~/vimfiles/bundle/ if you use Pathogen (vimscript #2332)).
This plugin can be used along with clang_complete plugin (vimscript #3302). And maybe with some others completion plugins that I haven&#039t tested (inccomplete should work if it&#039ll be loaded after some other completion plugin).

versions.release_notes: Bug Fix: Cached <>-include list wasn't updated after changing 'path' option.
